body.name: MSI PRO Z790-A WiFi ProSeries Motherboard (Supports 12th/13th Gen Intel Processors, LGA 1700, DDR5, PCIe 5.0, M.2, 2.5Gbps LAN, USB 3.2 Gen2, Wi-Fi 6E, ATX)

features: Supports 12th/13th Gen Intel Core, Pentium Gold, and Celeron Processors
Supports DDR5 Memory, up to 7200 plus(OC) MHz
Enhanced Power Design: 16 plus1 plus1 DRPS with 80A SPS, dual 8-pin CPU power connectors, Core Boost, Memory Boost

Premium Thermal Solution: Extended Heatsink, MOSFET thermal pads rated for 7W/mK, additional choke thermal pads and M.2 Shield Frozr are built for high performance system and non-stop gaming experience
High Quality PCB: 6-layer PCB made by 2oz thickened copper and server grade level material
body.description: PRO Z790-A WIFI is designed with tons of flexible tools and convenient Wi-Fi solution with DDR5 memory version. The PRO Series is tailored to professionals from all walks of life. The lineup features impressive performance and high quality, while aiming to provide users incredible experience. Users who care about productivity and efficiency can definitely count on the MSI PRO Series to assist you with multitasking and increasing efficiency.

productInformation.name: Customer Reviews
productInformation.value: 4.5 4.5 out of 5 stars 228 ratings 4.5 out of 5 stars

productInformation.name: Compatible Processors
productInformation.value: Intel Core 14th/ 13th/ 12th Gen Processors, Intel Pentium Gold and Celeron Processors

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 3, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars 1st Time Build And It Went Great
reviews.reviewText: This was my first build and from that perspective this board was great. The only thing that felt wrong was inserting the ram. Every thing was compatible my ram was corsair but inserting it was really hard. I'm not sure if its the board, the ram, or just cause I've never done it before, but it was the only scary part of the build. Everything else went smoothly and looks great, the Bios is pretty easy for a noob to navigate.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 21, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Stable and fast
reviews.reviewText: Pros: very fast board made a good home for my 13600KF . Boot times are very good. In comparing this to the MSI Z790 Tomahawk Max , that I had to return , it beats it hands down In fact ANY of the so called " Z790 refresh " boards have no real reason to exist . Case in point Any of those boards that support a NVME 5.0 SSD do do by cutting Your graphics card down from 16x to 8x. So if You use ANY SSD in the M.2 PCIE 5.0 slot Your Graphics card will suffer I see that this Z790 Pro is pretty much Identical in bios options compared to the Z790 Tomahawk . So why pay more ? Fully supports all MY RGB lights and does it well , but no RGB on the board itselfCons:The board I got shipped with full support for 14th Gen CPUs BUT it shipped with a Bios version A.60 which is VERY buggy . In fact MSI took this version down due to problems. Be sure to have Bios version A7.0 . This is the best version according to many posts on the MSI forum . A6.0 will cause the OS to crash . Minor con, The bios boot screen and bios color scheme are all in black and white , no color at all.Oh and finally , No User manual , I had to print My own . MSI cheeped out , and makes You scan a QR code on Your phone. Come on MSI Really ? ( rolleyes)

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 24, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Works great - but you may want to tweak a few settings
reviews.reviewText: Pros:• Aside from an issue with a certain TV I was initially trying to use it did POST and get to the BIOS screen after I plugged in a PC monitor.• Windows 11 install was fine. Ethernet port worked out of the box for immediate connection to the Internet and no driver install required that Windows doesn't handle automatically. i.e. Windows 11 just works when installing from USB.Some minor nits that I'm giving it 4 stars for. But after tweaking, it's a 5-star experience.Nits:• It recognized my 13th Gen Core i9-13900 on first POST. The BIOS version was a 2022 version. A bios update was required for it to enable the XMP profiles on my RAM. (I only used 5200mhz Corsair RAM). I already anticipated all this and had the updated BIOS ready to go on a USB key. It was easy and painless to update the BIOS.• When you first get to the Windows desktop after installing the OS, the Windows Platform Binary Table of the OS feature will attempt to run an MSI specific EXE from the motherboard. This will prompt you to install the MSI Software Center. Honestly, you should to decline to install it and/or disable this feature from the BIOS settings. Otherwise, it puts some bloatware on the computer like Norton 360 trial edition, outdated versions of CpuID, and some cheezy software. And the MSI program would often show up in the task manager as one of the most active programs. Again, without all this, Windows 11 will put on the latest stable drivers including Nvidia GPU drivers. I wound up doing a clean install of Windows 11 so this stuff wouldn't get laid down at all.• Most important. On the first bios update, a dialog pops up on the BIOS screen asking you to declare what type of cooler you have: "box", "tower air", or "liquid". Given the graphic for liquid showed an AIO cooler similar to mine, that's what I picked up. DO NOT pick "liquid". This has the side effect of setting the Long Duration Power Limit (PL1) and Short Term Power Limit (PL2) to unlimited. This has the effect of running any popular benchmark software program such as Prime95, Cinebench, CpuID, etc... to have the cores hit the 100 degree thermal limit within a minute. I seriously thought my AIO cooler wasn't working at all. After some research, I experimented with setting the cooler profile in the bios between "box" and "tower air". "Box" runs your power limits to match Intel's spec and then you won't hit those high temperatures at all. If you want a little overclocking performance without taking a risk, you can do what I did: Set "tower air" as the cooler profile and change the thermal throttle cap from 100 degrees to 95. That should solve most of the issues around high temperatures and Core-i9 processors with this board. You can also lower the long term power (PL1) to be slightly lower than PL2 and lower the transition time. YMMV.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 24, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Nice features, fair price
reviews.reviewText: All the features I NEEDED. I really wanted the MSI glowy dragon on the heat sinks, but the only board that was in stock that had that was used, and I have a thing about used boards... I don't. I just do not.MSI has come a long way in their user support. The videos showing how to hook up the last few things that gave me some trouble were fantastic.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 10, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Soild Product for the Money
reviews.reviewText: Has most of the features you would want in a standard mother board:Good Front panel connectionsLots of Fan pinsDecent Build qualityBuilt-in Wifi and BluetoothMultiple M.2 SlotsThe front IO are in good locations. Only exception would be the audio one which is on the bottom left.Some of the M.2 slots may get blocked by the graphics card so be aware of that.Be careful with the RGB pins as this was the only part of the product that I almost damaged during installation.BIOS is straight forward for the most part. BIOS flash worked as advertised.Overall I can not complain about the price to performance that this board provides.
Great mobo, games like a beast.
El producto llegó en caja abierta y estaba dañado.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on January 24, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: Cutting-Edge performance with all the bells and whistles
reviews.reviewText: As a previous ASUS fanboy, I had my concerns...The MSI PRO Z790-A WiFi ProSeries Motherboard has proven to be the backbone of my new high-performance desktop setup, showcasing advanced features that perfectly complement my Intel® Core™ i7-14700KF processor. Tailored for 12th/13th Gen Intel Processors and equipped with DDR5 support, PCIe 5.0, and multiple M.2 slots, this ATX motherboard is a testament to MSI's commitment to delivering cutting-edge technology to the desktop computing world.The compatibility with the Intel i7-14700KF has unlocked the full potential of my system, providing a seamless and responsive computing experience. The Z790-A WiFi ProSeries motherboard seamlessly integrates with the powerful capabilities of the i7-14700KF, delivering exceptional performance across a spectrum of applications, from gaming to content creation.One standout feature is the support for DDR5 memory, a technological leap that enhances overall system speed and responsiveness. The DDR5 support, coupled with the motherboard's optimized layout, ensures that my system operates at peak efficiency, handling multitasking and resource-intensive tasks with ease.The inclusion of PCIe 5.0 represents a significant step forward in data transfer speeds. This feature is particularly noteworthy for users who demand high-speed data access, such as gamers and content creators. The motherboard's ability to harness the power of PCIe 5.0 contributes to a smoother and more responsive computing experience.The presence of multiple M.2 slots is a game-changer for storage enthusiasts. It allows for the seamless integration of high-speed NVMe SSDs, providing lightning-fast data access and reducing load times for applications and games. The flexibility to expand storage without compromising on performance is a key advantage of the Z790-A WiFi ProSeries.The 2.5Gbps LAN and Wi-Fi 6E support further enhance connectivity options, ensuring fast and reliable network performance. USB 3.2 Gen2 ports provide convenient and high-speed data transfer capabilities for a variety of peripherals, adding to the motherboard's overall versatility.Installation was a breeze, and the user-friendly BIOS interface simplifies the customization of settings, catering to both novice and experienced users. The simple and effective BIOS Flash USB port and button, is an absolute game changer, making it so easy to install new generation CPUs. The ATX form factor provides ample space for expansion, making this motherboard suitable for a range of desktop configurations.In conclusion, the MSI PRO Z790-A WiFi ProSeries Motherboard stands as a pinnacle of innovation, combining compatibility with the latest Intel processors, DDR5 support, PCIe 5.0, and multiple M.2 slots. It has elevated my computing experience, showcasing the kind of performance and features that enthusiasts and professionals crave. If you're in search of a motherboard that embraces the future of desktop computing, the Z790-A WiFi ProSeries is a stellar choice.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on February 7, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Lots of compatibility issues with flashing BIOS not solving issues with brand new i7 processor and brand new DDR5 memory. Lost a week now trying to replace or fix. Very dissatisfied with MSI
